cookies.completed.msg: You've already completed the census. Do you want to complete another for a family member?
banner.leftSection.title: FLATTEN THE CURVE IN YOUR CITY
banner.leftSection.desription1: Contribute to solving a public health issue by being part of the census.
banner.leftSection.desription2: The anonymous data gathered will be made public to help our communities, health care system, scientist and innovators make informed decisions.
banner.rigthSection.description1: Please Note: If you think you may have a life-threatening emergency, immediately call your doctor or contact your local emergency services.
banner.rigthSection.description2: Remember: National and local authorities will have the most up to date information on the spread of COVID-19 in your area. They are best placed to advise on what people in your area should be doing to protect themselves.
howprotect.title: BE PART OF THE
howprotect.washyourhands.title: Wash Your Hands
howprotect.washyourhands.description: Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water. Why? Washing your hands with soap and water or using alcohol-based hand rub kills viruses that may be on your hands.
howprotect.dontouchyourface.title: Don’t Touch Your Face
howprotect.dontouchyourface.description: Why? Hands touch many surfaces and can pick up viruses. Once contaminated, hands can transfer the virus to your eyes, nose or mouth. From there, the virus can enter your body and can make you sick.
howprotect.avoid.title: Avoid Social Physical Contact
howprotect.avoid.description: Maintain at least 1 metre (3 feet) distance between yourself and anyone who is coughing or sneezing. Why? When someone coughs or sneezes they spray small liquid droplets from their nose or mouth which may contain virus. If you are too close, you can breathe in the droplets, including the COVID-19 virus if the person coughing has the disease.
howprotect.respitory.title: Practice respiratory hygiene
howprotect.respitory.description: Make sure you, and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene. This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Then dispose of the used tissue immediately. Why? Droplets spread virus. By following good respiratory hygiene you protect the people around you from viruses such as cold, flu and COVID-19.
howprotect.cough.title: If you have fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical care early
howprotect.cough.description: Stay home if you feel unwell. If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention and call in advance. Follow the directions of your local health authority. Why? National and local authorities will have the most up to date information on the situation in your area. Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility. This will also protect you and help prevent spread of viruses and other infections.
howprotect.right.description: Stay informed of the latest COVID-19 developments. Follow the advice given by your healthcare provider, your national and local public health authority, and your employer on how to protect yourself and others from COVID-19.
wizard.dynamic.question3: Do you have hypertension? (High Blood Pressure)
wizard.dynamic.question4: Do you have diabetes? (Type 1 or Type 2)
wizard.dynamic.question5: Do you have coronary heart disease?
wizard.dynamic.question9: Do you have sputum? Do you have a cough that is producing mucus/phlegm?
wizard.dynamic.question12: Do you have myalgia? Are you experiencing any muscle aches or pain?
wizard.dynamic.question13: Do you have nausea or vomiting?
wizard.dynamic.question15: Have you been in contact with people recently traveling or people that may have the virus?
footer.minds.title: Policies
wizard.finish.title: We Don’t Have Enough Information On Your Location to Provide Further Insights.
wizard.finish.description: Please help us by sharing this census with your neighbors and friends all over the world. All of the gathered census data is available at:
